page.title: 03INDUSTRY GAMEKEEPING ETC.
page.content: Gamekeepers are employed by the estates to keep the farm lands free of rabbits and to keep stocks of grouse pheasants and patridges for the shooting parties in the autumn. At these shoots many local people are employed as beaters. The keepers also keep the area free of foxes. There is a carpenters business at Milltown of Kildrummy employing three carpenters who undertake all the joinery work in the area and further afield. The staff at the Kildrummy Castle Gardens live in the community and the estate employs a forester.The catering and domestic staff at the Inn and the Kildrummy Castle Hotel are drawn from the local community .There are two teachers who teach at schools a few miles from Kildrummy.
